name: Titanium.UI.iPhone.SystemButtonStyle
summary: A set of constants for the system button styles that can be used for the button style property.

constants.name: BAR
constants.summary: Used with Titanium.UI.ButtonBar or Titanium.UI.iOS.TabbedBar only, to use the more condensed style used in nav bars and tool bars.
constants.description: To use a background color or gradient on a ButtonBar or TabbedBar control, you must use the BAR style. This style creates translucent buttons that allow the bar's background color to show through.

constants.name: BORDERED
constants.summary: A simple button style with a border.
constants.description:
Default style for normal buttons. May also be used for toolbar buttons.

When used with Titanium.UI.ButtonBar or Titanium.UI.iOS.TabbedBar, specifies a standard bar with a heavier border.

constants.name: DONE
constants.summary: The style for a Done button--for example, a button that completes some task and returns to the previous view.

constants.name: PLAIN
constants.summary: Specifies a borderless button, the default style for toolbars, button bars, and tabbed bars.
constants.description:
In toolbars, this specifies an undecorated button with large text. A glow effect is used when tapped.

In button bars and tabbed bars, specifies a button with large text that is highlighted when tapped.

When used on a normal button (that is, outside of a navigation bar, toolbar, button bar or tabbed bar), PLAIN specifies a button with no built-in decoration except its title text. This is the style you should choose if you want to supply your own background images, background gradient, and so on.

Note that for tabbed bar or button bars, the BAR style is used to allow the bar's background color or gradient to show through.
